input_text:
Job Title: Staff Software Engineer - Interactive Computing

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Science

Description:
As a Software Development Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to convert Jupyter notebook applications into streamlined and dynamic applications. You will use your Python automation expertise to improve the functionality, usability, and performance of these applications, helping to fulfill our commitment to providing innovative solutions for data scientists and enhancing our platform's low/no code capabilities.

Technologies you'll engage with include:
- Python- JavaScript/TypeScript- React

Core job responsibilities:
Lead the process of converting Jupyter notebooks into applications, ensuring a top-tier notebook experience in our platform's workspaces/IDE.Design, develop, test, and maintain automated Python code to boost the robustness and scalability of the applications.Employ Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) manipulation techniques to optimize and automate the conversion process, ensuring accurate and efficient transformation of Jupyter notebook logic into application structures.Collaborate with UX/UI designers, product managers, and other engineers to deliver a cohesive and user-friendly application experience.Conduct code reviews with a focus on effective use of AST in the conversion process.Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in the applications, using AST-based optimizations for optimal responsiveness and user experience.Manage the seamless integration of new features/products within our platform.Keep abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies, continuously seeking ways to enhance our platform.
Job requirements:
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field with at least 5 years of relevant experience.7+ years of proven experience as a Full Stack Engineer, skilled in Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, and React.A strong track record in technical engineering roles, demonstrating significant contributions and deliveries in a product-centric environment.Ability to thrive in a remote-first, fast-paced, dynamic environment.Desire to learn new technologies and platforms and troubleshoot complex issues.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the capability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.Commitment to writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
Assets:
Experience with GraphQL, NestJS, Kubernetes, CI/GitHub Actions, Docker.Experience with computational notebooks like Jupyter, Mathematica, Observable.Familiarity with data visualization libraries and concepts.
This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a team that is passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and improving the way businesses use data.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
